# enableWaterLock()

**Instance Method**

Disables the Apple Watch touch screen to prevent accidental taps while the watch is underwater.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor func enableWaterLock()
```

## Discussion

The following rules apply when using Water Lock:

- You must call the [doc://com.apple.watchkit/documentation/WatchKit/WKInterfaceDevice/enableWaterLock()] method from the main thread.
- You can only enable Water Lock when the app is running in the foreground during an active workout or location session.
- The app must be running on a supported device (the [doc://com.apple.watchkit/documentation/WatchKit/WKInterfaceDevice] object’s [doc://com.apple.watchkit/documentation/WatchKit/WKInterfaceDevice/waterResistanceRating] property must be set to [doc://com.apple.watchkit/documentation/WatchKit/WKWaterResistanceRating/wr50]).
- Water Lock remains active until the user unlocks it. You can’t programmatically unlock the watch.

## Managing the user interface

- **isAutorotating**: A Boolean value that determines whether the interface automatically rotates when the user flips their wrist.
- **isAutorotated**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the system has automatically rotated the user interface so that it is properly oriented for another viewer.
- **globalTintColor**: The watchOS app’s global tint color.
